title: Biden administration may halt plans to move Space Command to Alabama over state's abortion law, officials say
description: Some U.S. officials believe the White House wants to halt plans to move Space Command’s headquarters to Alabama in part due to the state’s restrictive abortion law.

title: Washington is struggling to catch up on artificial intelligence
description: As industry experts and academics sound alarm bells, Washington has quickly turned its attention to artificial intelligence.

title: Special counsel issues report criticizing FBI for launching Trump-Russia investigation
description: The special counsel who spent four years investigating the Trump-Russia probe accused the FBI of acting negligently.

title: Navy retirees see cuts to monthly benefits, must repay $7M after system overpayment error
description: The federal government is attempting to recoup almost $7 million from more than 1,200 Navy retirees after it discovered a system error had given them larger monthly payments for nearly four years

title: At least 3 people killed and 2 officers wounded in New Mexico shooting, police say
description: Four people, including a suspect, were killed and two police officers wounded during a shooting in northwest New Mexico on Monday, authorities said.

title: Elon Musk still needs 'Twitter sitter,' judges rule
description: Tesla CEO Elon Musk lost an appeal to unwind parts of a consent decree that he and the automaker struck with the Securities and Exchange Commission to settle civil securities fraud charges in 2018.

title: Person attacked Virginia congressman's staff with a baseball bat at district office
description: WASHINGTON — A person with a baseball bat entered the district office of Rep.

title: Pacific Northwest heat wave continues after historic weekend
description: Monday is day four of what has been a rare and historic heat wave during the month of May for parts of the Pacific Northwest.

title: 'Succession' sparks election anxiety online with latest episode
description: 'Succession' sparks election anxiety online with latest episode, titled 'America Decides'

title: Supreme Court rejects Alabama's bid to use lethal injection against inmate's wishes
description: Supreme Court won't hear Alabama's bid to execute a death row inmate by lethal injection despite a lower court ruling his preference for lethal gas was viable.

title: Florida girl, 13, fought back against a shark after being bitten on her arms, legs and stomach
description: A 13-year-old girl bravely fended off a shark in the waters off of Fort Pierce, Florida, and is recovering after the attack left her with bites on her torso, arm, finger and knee.

title: Al Roker shares update after knee replacement surgery
description: Al Roker on Monday made a video call to TODAY on May 15 to update his progress since undergoing a total knee replacement on May 9 that now has him resting at home.

title: TSA tests facial recognition technology to boost airport security
description: Facial recognition technology is currently in 16 airports, but critics have have raised concerns about questions of bias in facial recognition technology.

title: Horse dies at Churchill Downs marking 8th recent fatality at home of Kentucky Derby
description: A horse died Sunday after a race at Churchill Downs, making it the eighth fatality in recent weeks at the home of the Kentucky Derby.

title: The Philadelphia Inquirer wasn't able to print its Sunday newspaper due to cyberattack
description: The Philadelphia Inquirer experienced the most significant disruption to its operations in 27 years due to what the newspaper calls a cyberattack.

title: The big problem with trying to cut spending in a debt ceiling bill
description: House Republicans are pushing Democrats to accept a debt ceiling bill that limits spending ahead of another meeting with President Joe Biden this week.

title: Colorado Rockies pitcher suffered a skull fracture after getting hit in head by line drive
description: Colorado pitcher Ryan Feltner has a skull fracture and concussion after getting hit by a line drive off the bat of Philadelphia’s Nick Castellanos.

title: Vice Media files for bankruptcy to facilitate sale
description: Vice Media Group, popular for websites such as Vice and Motherboard, filed for bankruptcy protection on Monday to engineer its sale to a group of lenders, capping years of financial difficulties and top-executive departures.

title: As debt default looms, America yawns
description: A nation that has been deluged with head-spinning news day after day is now confronting a possible debt crisis and Americans seem ready to sit this one out.

title: 2-time world champion Doyle Brunson, called the Godfather of Poker, dies at 89
description: Doyle Brunson, one of the most influential poker players of all time and a two-time world champion, died Sunday, according to his agent.
